page.title: 08CUMBERLAND SAUSAGE
page.content: One of the foods that is unique to Cumbria is the{Cumberland sausage. Basically it is a{pork sausage}with different{herbs and spices.}Most butchers make their own sausage and as far as I know it is not mass produced or sold in pre packs or frozen. At first Cumberland sausage may not appear very nice to the eye as it lacks the smooth texture of the miced meat of ordinary sausage. It also has a{strong taste}and is very{fatty meaning that it was probably a strong favourite among the poor of the past who could afford this meat. After trying Cumberland sausage a few times I got used to it's strong taste and now I quite like it. Indeed I often have it for breakfast.
